sense.name: produce, carry out
sense.examples: The candidate delivered a compelling argument for his position during the debate. The plaintiff hoped the jury would deliver a verdict in his favor. The child delivered a yelp of delight at the pile of presents. He kept delivering blows to his opponent's left temple.

sense.name: carry, bring, hand over
sense.examples: The prisoners will be delivered to the maximum security prison. The terrorist was delivered to the authorities of his own country. She won't deliver those documents to the commission without legal pressure. They will be delivering the new furniture tomorrow.

sense.name: rescue, save
sense.examples: The fireman was able to deliver the children from the burning building. Deliver us from evil.

sense.name: throw, hurl (sports)
sense.examples: The pitcher delivered the ball just over the inside corner of the plate for a strike. Steiner delivered the ball to Mack in stride over the middle at the 40.

sense.name: DELIVER THE GOODS: attain success, reach a goal
sense.examples: Martinelli's speech really delivered the goods to the audience.
